channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: French central bank governor pushes for crypto licensing ahead of EU laws
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: The Bank of France’s head said turmoil in the crypto markets proves the need to move to a mandatory licensing scheme for crypto firms "as soon as possible."

item.title: Mutant Ape Planet creator arrested in NY for alleged $2.9M NFT 'fraud'
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: The developer of a Mutant Ape Yacht Club knock-off collection has allegedly “defrauded” investors of $2.9 million and admitted to a rug pull.

item.title: Asia Express: China’s NFT market, Moutai metaverse popular but buggy…
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun

item.title: US authorities are turning their attention to FTX’s Nishad Singh: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: FTX’s bankruptcy filings show a $543 million loan to former engineering director Nishad Singh, who was reportedly a part of the secret ‘wirefraud’ chat group.

item.title: CME Group to launch 3 metaverse reference rates
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: Axie Infinity, Chiliz and Decentraland will be represented in CME’s new reference rates and real-time indexes.

item.title: DeFi security losses rose 47.4% in 2022 to hit $3.64B: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Over $1.40 billion worth of stolen DeFi funds was reportedly laundered via Tornado Cash during that period.

item.title: Crypto lender Genesis lays off 30% more staff: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Genesis announced in August that it planned to cut its then-260-person workforce by 20%, with CEO Michael Moro moving into an advisory role.

item.title: US authorities to intensify scrutiny of crypto industry in 2023
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The Securities and Exchange Commission, Financial Accounting Standards Board and Internal Revenue Service are working to tighten crypto regulations and expand industry oversight.

item.title: Quantum computers may soon breach blockchain cryptography: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: Cryptography experts are somewhat skeptical of the technique’s scalability but aren’t ruling out the possibility of success either.

item.title: ECB official urges CBDC development for the good of cryptocurrency and consumers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: ECB board member Fabio Panetta has woven his enthusiasm for blockchain technology and skepticism of cryptocurrency into an argument that supports both, albeit begrudgingly.

item.title: US senator behind efforts to pass major crypto bill won’t seek re-election
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Senator Debbie Stabenow was one of the lawmakers behind introducing the Digital Commodities Consumer Protection Act in August.

item.title: Crypto in 2023 — Do bulls have a chance? Watch Market Talks on Cointelegraph
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Cointelegraph
item.description: Join us as we discuss what 2023 holds for crypto. Hosting the show will be Cointelegraph’s head of markets, Ray Salmond, with special guest Mohit Sorout.

item.title: Three Arrows Capital founders subpoenaed on Twitter
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: 3AC founders Zhu Su and Kyle Davies have been ordered to provide all documents in their possession or control, regardless of whether the information is held by them directly or is in control of a third party.

item.title: Redeeming physical NFTs: Easier said than done?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rachel Wolfson
item.description: A number of challenges must be overcome in order for “phygital” NFT projects to gain traction.

item.title: Alex Mashinsky sued by NY AG for allegedly hiding Celsius’ ‘dire financial condition’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: Alex Mashinsky’s actions leading up to Celsius declaring bankruptcy allegedly contributed to investor losses by misrepresenting the platform’s financial condition.

item.title: What is institutional DeFi, and how can banks benefit?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arunkumar Krishnakumar
item.description: Institutional DeFi could be a new paradigm that banks can leverage for product innovation, new pricing models and operational efficiencies.

item.title: How to buy Bitcoin with Apple Pay?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shailey Singh
item.description: Buy Bitcoin with Apple Pay using iPhone and iOS devices on various leading cryptocurrency exchanges including Binance, Coinbase, BitPay and more.

item.title: StarkNet overhauls Cairo programming language to drive developer adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Gareth Jenkinson
item.description: Ethereum layer-2 scaling platform StarkNet has revamped its Cairo programming language to enable easier onboarding of new developers.

item.title: MyEtherWallet CEO talks about the future of crypto self-custody
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elisha Owusu Akyaw
item.description: Tune in to the third episode of Hashing It Out as Cointelegraph’s Elisha Owusu Akyaw discusses the future of noncustodial cryptocurrency wallets with Kosala Hemachandra, CEO of MyEtherWallet.

item.title: FTX’s former top lawyer cooperated with the US in Sam Bankman-Fried case
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: FTX’s former compliance chief, Daniel Friedberg, started working for Sam Bankman-Fried in 2017 and resigned from FTX days before the exchange collapsed.

item.title: Silvergate sold assets at loss and cut staff to cover $8.1B in withdrawals: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Silvergate has reportedly laid off 200 members of its staff, which is around 40% of its total number of employees.

item.title: Hong Kong lawmaker wants to turn CBDC into stablecoin featuring DeFi
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: A Hong Kong official believes that a government-backed stablecoin would serve as a better entry point to Web3 compared to private stablecoins.

item.title: Bank of England answers professionals’ questions about upcoming CBDC wallet
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Bank of England answered more than 70 questions from applicants who wish to win over the $244,000 contract.

item.title: Logan Paul threatens to sue Coffeezilla over CryptoZoo ‘scam’ allegations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: YouTube boxer Logan Paul, who was spearheading the CryptoZoo NFT project, has accused Coffeezilla of publishing “defamation” about him and the project.

item.title: ‘Big move brewing’ for BTC price? Bitcoin may stay flat, hints analyst
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The Bitcoin Bollinger Band “squeeze” is not a firm indicator of a breakout, says the metric’s creator.

item.title: Twitter data breach: Hacker put 200M users’ private information up for grabs
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The hacker had demanded $200,000 to return the breached data back in December but warned that if their conditions are not fulfilled, they will release the data for free.

item.title: Mango Markets exploiter Avraham Eisenberg ordered into detention pending trial
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: A United States Magistrate Judge determined that it was necessary to detain the Mango Markets exploiter before finishing the trial.

item.title: LastPass data breach led to $53K in Bitcoin stolen, lawsuit alleges
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: A class action is seeking damages from the password manager following a data breach in August 2022.

item.title: Crypto firm Juno urges users to withdraw after ‘uncertainty’ with custody partner
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: Juno recommended users pull their funds from the platform amid “uncertainty” over the fate of its crypto custody provider Wyre.

item.title: Fanatic sells 60% stake in Candy Digital amid ‘imploding NFT market’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: The sports merchandise giant has got cold feet in the shrinking NFT market.
